comment.content: What I've seen is it appends jsessionid to the url for the first page. After that it doesn't append anything.

post.content:
Our application does not use cookie for session tracking, so had to turn off cookie mode for session in Tomcat3. Now, the app is moved up to tomcat 4, with different format of server.xml, which does not provide the tag for the user to turn off cookies.
What I am not sure is Tomcat 4's default session tracking is based on URL rewritting or still cookie?
Anyone has this sort of issue with tomcat 4?
Thank you!
